Usage

2011-11-16

An overview of how to use the couchdb-maven-plugin

Developing Couch Applications

The plugin defines a new packaging type and so you must ensure that extensions is set to true in your plugin declaration:

Example 1. Adding the plugin to a project

<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0">
    ...
    
    <build>
        <!-- To define the plugin version in your parent POM -->
        <pluginManagement>
            <plugins>
                <plugin>
                    <groupId>org.dthume.couchdb</groupId>
                    <artifactId>couchdb-maven-plugin</artifactId>
                    <version>0.2</version>
                    <extensions>true</extensions>
                </plugin>

                ...
            </plugins>
        </pluginManagement>
        <!-- To use the plugin goals in your POM or parent POM -->
        <plugins>
            <plugin>
                <groupId>org.dthume.couchdb</groupId>
                <artifactId>couchdb-maven-plugin</artifactId>
                <version>0.2</version>
                <extensions>true</extensions>
            </plugin>

            ...
        </plugins>
    </build>
    
    ...
</project>


With this done, you can then declare projects with a packaging of couchapp:

Example 2. Defining a couchapp project

<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0">
    <groupId>my.group.id</groupId>
    <artifactId>some-couch-project</artifactId>
    <version>1.0-SNAPSHOT</version>
    <packaging>couchapp</packaging>
    ...
</project>


which will bind the default set of couchapp goals to the lifecycle.

Couchapps should be placed under couchapp.sourceDirectory, which defaults to: ${basedir}src/main/couchapp. The directory structure is as follows: 

src/main/couchapp/
|- application_1/
|  |- views/
|     |- view_1/
|     |  |- map.js
|     |  |- reduce.js (optional)
|     |- view_2/
|        |- map.js
|- application_2/ (optional)
   ... same as above ...

Working with Couch DB Instances

The plugin also provides a set of goals for working directly with live CouchDB instances, including document retrieval and deployment of couchapps. These goals all require additional configuration; specifically the host, port, authentication details and database name of the couch server. Currently only basic security is supported.
